wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-General Alexander Adams (baptised 4 April 1772 – 12 September 1834) was a British army officer. He distinguished himself in the Second Anglo-Maratha War, serving with the 78th Highlanders in India. His commander, General Wellesley (later Duke of Wellington), thanked him for his services on several occasions. After the 1811 invasion of Java, he was appointed to a command in the army, and also as minister at the court of the emperor or Susuhunan Pakubuwono IV.

response: *Alexander Adams (British Army officer) (died 1835), lieutenant-general in the British Army
*Alexander Adams (Hawaii) (1780–1871), Scotsman who served in the Royal Navy and the navy of the Kingdom of Hawaii
*Alexander Adams (British Army officer) (1772–1834), British Army lieutenant general
